intro: Phlox douglasii subsp. eudouglasii, commonly known as the Douglas phlox, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. The plant produces showy clusters of pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer.
